result.execSummary:
The defendant Dale J Wolfe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 10/16/2015 @ 1:30pm, Br-23

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges.

- No contact with firearms. Court advised that under 48USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

- Batterers Intervention program.
- Parenting classes.
- Mental Health Evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
- Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
- Treatment and/or counseling as determined by Agent.
- No Contact with victim Melissa W., unless approved by Court or Agent, except for third party contact for time with the children.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Obtain GED/HSED.

records.addlTxt:
Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  Review hearing is cancelled.
cab
Br. 36 is unavailable on 10/16/2015, matter is adjourned to 09/18/2015 at 1:30 pm.

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 8 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for 5 DAYS time served, with Huber. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 60 DAYS as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Parenting classes.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim Melissa W., unless approved by court or agent, except for third party contact for time with the children.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-Obtain GED/HSED.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation

Defendant Dale J Wolfe in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea & Sentencing.
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dale J Wolfe in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request adjournment of the plea and sentencing.  Stipulation for a New Court Date signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Victim present in court requesting modification of the No Contact orders to a No Violent Contact order.  State opposes.  Court modifies No Contact Order to ONLY allow for third party contact for time with child.

Defendant Dale J Wolfe in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Plea & Sentencing. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Plea & Sentencing to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MELISSA W.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Dale J Wolfe in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Dale J Wolfe in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
